[wp_options][blogdescription].label: Blog Description
[wp_options][blogdescription].description: A tag line that will appear beneath your blog name

[wp_directory].label: WordPress Directory
[wp_directory].description: The name of the directory to install WordPress. Leave empty to install in your web site's root.

[HTTP_HOST].label: Domain
[HTTP_HOST].description: e.g. example.com. The domain of your site. This setting is only used when called by command line. The web form uses the predefined  $_SERVER['HTTP_HOST'] variable.

[profile].label: Profile
[profile].description: Select a profile, a collection of WordPress settings, plugins and themes that are grouped together in the profiles directory.

[wpDownload].label: wpDownload
[wpDownload].description: Download the latest version of WordPress and extract it to the WordPress installation directory.

[wpConfig].label: wpConfig
[wpConfig].description: Create wp-config.php files and update the wp-options table with site and profile settings.

[wpInstallCore].label: wpInstallCore
[wpInstallCore].description: Install WordPress. Includes creating WordPress tables and configuring logins

[wpInstallThemes].label: wpInstallThemes
[wpInstallThemes].description: Install themes by copying over any directory or zip file from the Profile's 'themes' directory.

[wpInstallPlugins].label: wpInstallPlugins
[wpInstallPlugins].description: Install plugins by copying over any directory or zip file from the Profile's 'plugins' directory, or as specified by $config[plugins] array.

[wpResetPassword].label: wpResetPassword
[wpResetPassword].description: Reset the WordPress admin password for an existing installation.

[debug-show-exceptions].label: Show Exceptions
[debug-show-exceptions].description: Shows Mod WP exception trace. Turn on only if you are debugging Mod WP (not WordPress)

[reinstall].label: Reinstall
[reinstall].description: Set to true to force overwrite of WordPress installation directory and database.

[slide_rule].label: Slide Rule
[slide_rule].description: Set to true create `_live` , `_stage`, and `_dev` `wp-config.php` files when used with the Slide Rule project

[set_permissions].label: Set Permissions
[set_permissions].description: Attempt to set file permissions, locking down configuration files and preventing unauthorized access.

[max_execution_time].label: Max Execution Time
[max_execution_time].description: Maximum Execution Time allowed for a PHP script. Set this value to at least 300 if you are recieving installation failures due to timing issues.A value of 0 or less will cause the value in the php.ini to be used.

[move_wpconfig].label: Move wp-config.php
[move_wpconfig].description: This determines whether the `wp-config.php` file is moved to a separate 'config' directory that can be placed in the same directory as root (default) or, more securely, above the web root.

[wp_options][template].label: Theme
[wp_options][template].description: The WordPress theme to be selected upon installation. The theme must be available after wpInstallThemes  and remove_themes

[add_custom_content].label: Add Custom Content
[add_custom_content].description: Whether to add the custom content for posts and pages.
